data.title: AIM Vernon from Butler, New Jersey
data.meta_description: Get this AIM Vernon page for free from Friday, December 1, 2006 SPORTS CHAMPS AGAIN HHHKHMHH tMU Hmm hM-v A Skyhawks begin improvements by retaining key players Ben.... Edition of AIM Vernon
data.text:
SPORTS CHAMPS AGAIN HHHKHMHH tMU Hmm hM-v A Skyhawks begin improvements by retaining key players Ben Wittkowski, General Manager of the Sussex Skyhawks, announced the team has exercised the options on the following players for the 2007 season: Pitchers Jose Correa, Brian Ford, Joe Gault, Michael Greenhouse, Derek Hawk, Mike Howell, Elvis Jimenez, Lincoln Mincks, Julio Perez, Reid Price, Tim Tisch, Jake Upwood and Chris Zallie; Catchers Jason Alcott and Abraham Ayala; Second Basemen Magic Mears and Marcos Agramonte; Third Baseman Mayke Cabrera; Shortstop Robert LeNoir; Outfielders James Cooper, Scott Grimes and Josh Ury; and Designated Hitter Dick Daly Jr. "Improving the team's on-field performance is our top priority this offseason," said Wittkowski. "I am confident that, with the help of Manager Brian Drahman, next year's team will be more successful." "Our first season as the Sussex Skyhawks was a great experience and I am looking forward to managing the team again next year," said Manager Brian Drahman. "Last year, the team had great chemistry both on and off the field, and I am looking forward to building on the experiences we shared in the 2006 season to provide Skyhawks fans with an exciting and successful team in 2007' The Sussex Skyhawks ended their Inaugural 2006 season with 32-58 record. For the latest and most up-to-date information regarding the Sussex Skyhawks, visit www sussexskvhawks com, or call 973-300-1000 .

As part of the independent Can-Am league, each season the Skyhawks host 46 exciting games against the Brockton Rox, Nashua Pride, New Haven Cutters, New Jersey Jackals, North Shore Spirit, Les Capitals de Quebec, and the Worcester Tornadoes. The upcoming 2007 schedule will be released by the Can-Am league in the near future. For information on season tickets, ticket plans, events and birthday parties, visit: www.sussexskyhawks.com. YMCA honors donors The Sussex County YMCA, located at 15 Wits End Road in Hardyston, hosted a special dedication ceremony on Saturday, Sept. 30 to honor the Capital Campaign Donors, whose generous contributions helped raise the necessary funds to open the YMCA's new facility .

The ceremonies included the dedication of the Flag Pole, Brick Patio and Donor Tree, followed by light refreshments and a tour of the Sussex County YMCA. David Carcieri, Executive Director of the Sussex County YMCA, said, "This ceremony is but a small token of our appreciation to the Capital Campaign Donors who helped build this YMCA into the success that it is today. Without their generosity, the Sussex County YMCA would not have had the opportunity to expand to meet the needs of the community and make a positive impact on the lives of thousands of Sussex County residents." What people know today as the Sussex County YMCA is actually a far cry from where they began in 1976, as a community outreach program from their sister branch at the Fairview Lake YMCA. These programs were a big hit, and by 1980 the Sussex County YMCA received its PHOTO COURTESY OF BRIAN WHITE For the second time in only three seasons together the Wallkill Valley Arsenal U-11 boys travel soccer team are champions again. The Arsenal capped its impressive 9-1-season record with a 3-0 win over West Morris .

The Arsenal compete in the Morris County Youth Soccer Association and played teams from Morris and Sussex counties. Arsenal players reside in Hardyston, Franklin, Hamburg, Newton, Hampton, and Montague. Front row pictured left to right: Eric Yadvish, Louis Bustamante, Gabe Conrad, RJ Noll, James Dussinger, Ryan Neal, Joey Hamler. Second row: Eric Braun, Justin Felice, Kyle Lackey, Ben Galinski, Brady White, Jared Schreiber. Third Row: coaches Thad Dussinger, Joe Felice, Brian White, Ron Neal .

official charter and the new continued to operate as a "YMCA without walls," offering their programs in various satellite facilities throughout the county. Then in 1995 a feasibility study concluded that a full service YMCA was not only possible, but was actually in very high demand, and so began the YMCA's planning and fundraising efforts. Thanks to a successful Capital Campaign, the YMCA was able to raise the necessary money and move forward with their plans to serve the fitness needs of Sussex County residents.
